abstract: Hundreds of Muslim scholars hold conference in Marrakesh, Morocco, to confront violence in Islamic world; issue Marrakesh Declaration, which calls for Muslim countries to tolerate and protect religious minorities living within their borders--among them Christians, Jews, Hindus and Bahais as well as Yazidis and Sabians.
lead_paragraph: The gathering in Morocco of muftis, theologians and scholars issued a declaration welcomed by many as a hopeful sign, though also seen with some skepticism.

headline.main: Muslim Conference Calls for Protection of Religious Minorities
headline.print_headline: A Muslim Call for Tolerance of Religious Minorities
